bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 170, Number 72 (Friday, April 26, 2024)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. SOTO:H.R. 8138.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article I, Section 8, of the United States Constitution.The single subject of this legislation is:To direct the Secretary of Agriculture to establish adisaster response training program to train certain FarmService Agency employees to provide outreach and technicalassistance to farmers and ranchers affected by a naturaldisaster, and for other purposes.[Page H2635]

bill.title: To direct the Secretary of Agriculture to establish a disaster response training program to train certain Farm Service Agency employees to provide outreach and technical assistance to farmers and ranchers affected by a natural disaster, and for other purposes.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
